title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: When using the java editor, selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu to replace the contents of the window with the original is much slower compared to closing and reopening the file. After selecting 'Revert', it takes approximately 15 seconds for the replacement to occur. However, when performing the following steps: 1) Opening an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository, 2) Marking the file dirty by adding a space character at the end of the first line, and 3) Closing the editor by clicking on the close box and answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, reopening the file by double-clicking on it in the navigator takes only about 8 seconds.
OB: When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: After selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu, the replacement should occur without any noticeable delay.
SR: 1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 2) Add a space character at the end of the first line to mark the file as dirty. 3) Close the editor by clicking on the close box and choose 'no' when prompted to save changes. 4) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. The reopening process should be completed within 8 seconds. 5) Repeat steps 1) and 2), but this time select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor. The replacement of the contents of the window with the original should occur without any noticeable delay.
